title: MedicalTrial

http://schema.org/description.description: A short description of the item.

http://schema.org/sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

http://schema.org/mainEntityOfPage.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details. Inverse property: mainEntity.

http://schema.org/potentialAction.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

http://schema.org/additionalType.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

http://schema.org/image.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

http://schema.org/medicineSystem.description: The system of medicine that includes this MedicalEntity, for example 'evidence-based', 'homeopathic', 'chiropractic', etc.

http://schema.org/code.description: A medical code for the entity, taken from a controlled vocabulary or ontology such as ICD-9, DiseasesDB, MeSH, SNOMED-CT, RxNorm, etc.

http://schema.org/recognizingAuthority.description: If applicable, the organization that officially recognizes this entity as part of its endorsed system of medicine.

http://schema.org/guideline.description: A medical guideline related to this entity.

http://schema.org/study.description: A medical study or trial related to this entity.

http://schema.org/relevantSpecialty.description: If applicable, a medical specialty in which this entity is relevant.

http://schema.org/studyLocation.description: The location in which the study is taking/took place.

http://schema.org/studySubject.description: A subject of the study, i.e. one of the medical conditions, therapies, devices, drugs, etc. investigated by the study.

http://schema.org/outcome.description: Expected or actual outcomes of the study.

http://schema.org/population.description: Any characteristics of the population used in the study, e.g. 'males under 65'.

description: A medical trial is a type of medical study that uses scientific process used to compare the safety and efficacy of medical therapies or medical procedures. In general, medical trials are controlled and subjects are allocated at random to the different treatment and/or control groups.
